events.originalText: War in Afghanistan: A U.S. airstrike resulted in the reported deaths of eleven paramilitary members of the Pakistani Frontier Corps and eight Taliban fighters in Pakistan's tribal areas.
events.subtitle: War in Afghanistan (2001–2021)
events.headline: U.S. airstrike kills 11 paramilitary members in Pakistan

events.originalText: Sudan Airways Flight 109 crashed on landing at Khartoum International Airport, killing 30 of the 214 occupants on board.
events.subtitle: Sudan Airways Flight 109
events.headline: Sudan Airways Flight 109 crashes at Khartoum Airport, 30 dead

events.originalText: Eleven-year-old Jaycee Dugard was kidnapped in South Lake Tahoe, California; she remained a captive until 2009.
events.subtitle: Kidnapping of Jaycee Dugard
events.headline: 11-year-old Jaycee Dugard kidnapped in South Lake Tahoe

events.originalText: The Royal New Zealand Navy adopted a unique white ensign, to distinguish its vessels from those of the Royal Navy.
events.subtitle: Royal New Zealand Navy
events.headline: Royal New Zealand Navy adopts unique white ensign

events.originalText: Led by John Diefenbaker (pictured), the Progressive Conservative Party won a plurality of House of Commons seats in the Canadian federal election.
events.subtitle: John Diefenbaker
events.headline: Progressive Conservative Party wins Canadian federal election

events.originalText: American physician Bob Smith had his last alcoholic drink, marking the traditional founding date of Alcoholics Anonymous.
events.subtitle: Bob Smith (doctor)
events.headline: Alcoholics Anonymous founded by American physician Bob Smith

events.originalText: The United Church of Canada, the country's largest Protestant denomination, held its inaugural service at the Mutual Street Arena in Toronto.
events.subtitle: United Church of Canada
events.headline: United Church of Canada holds inaugural service in Toronto

events.originalText: World War I: Italian torpedo boats sank the Austro-Hungarian dreadnought SMS Szent István off the Dalmatian coast, killing 89 of the crew.
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: Italian torpedo boats sink Austro-Hungarian dreadnought SMS Szent István

events.originalText: Hussein bin Ali, King of Hejaz, orchestrated a revolt against the Ottoman Empire with the aim of creating a single unified and independent Arab state.
events.subtitle: Hussein bin Ali, King of Hejaz
events.headline: King of Hejaz orchestrates revolt against Ottoman Empire

events.originalText: Mount Tarawera, a volcano in New Zealand's North Island, erupted, killing around 120 people and creating the Waimangu Volcanic Rift Valley.
events.subtitle: Mount Tarawera
events.headline: Mount Tarawera eruption in New Zealand kills around 120

events.originalText: The League of Prizren was officially founded to "struggle in arms to defend the wholeness of the territories of Albania".
events.subtitle: League of Prizren
events.headline: League of Prizren founded to defend territories of Albania

events.originalText: American Civil War: The Confederate Army only suffered eight casualties in its victory in the Battle of Big Bethel in York County, Virginia.
events.subtitle: American Civil War
events.headline: Confederate Army victorious with only 8 casualties in Battle of Big Bethel

events.originalText: At least 28 unarmed Indigenous Australians were massacred at Myall Creek, New South Wales.
events.subtitle: Indigenous Australians
events.headline: Massacre of 28 Indigenous Australians at Myall Creek

events.originalText: Ten days after being formed by an earthquake, a landslide dam on the Dadu River in China was destroyed by an aftershock, causing a flood that killed an estimated 100,000 people.
events.subtitle: 1786 Kangding-Luding earthquake
events.headline: Landslide dam on Dadu River destroyed, causing flood and 100,000 deaths

events.originalText: King Rama I moved into the Grand Palace in Bangkok, which has remained the royal residence of Siam and Thailand since then.
events.subtitle: Rama I
events.headline: King Rama I moves into Grand Palace in Bangkok

events.originalText: Bridget Bishop became the first person to be executed for witchcraft in the Salem witch trials in colonial Massachusetts.
events.subtitle: Bridget Bishop
events.headline: Bridget Bishop executed for witchcraft in Salem witch trials

events.originalText: Thirty Years' War: France and the Dutch Republic concluded the Treaty of Compiègne, a mutual defence alliance.
events.subtitle: Thirty Years' War
events.headline: France and Dutch Republic form mutual defence alliance in Treaty of Compiègne

events.originalText: Byzantine–Ottoman wars: The heavily armed Byzantine army was defeated by Ottoman forces at the Battle of Pelekanon.
events.subtitle: Byzantine–Ottoman wars
events.headline: Byzantine army defeated by Ottomans at Battle of Pelekanon

events.originalText: Third Crusade: Frederick Barbarossa (pictured), Holy Roman Emperor, drowned in the Saleph River in Anatolia.
events.subtitle: Third Crusade
events.headline: Holy Roman Emperor Frederick Barbarossa drowns in Saleph River

events.originalText: Tatwine was consecrated  as Archbishop of Canterbury
events.subtitle: Tatwine
events.headline: Tatwine consecrated as Archbishop of Canterbury
